name: Discovery Point Club

reviews.text: After our second trip to Cayman, we included DPC in our lodging plans and were not disappointed. It is always so friendly and relaxing, plus Ollie and Diane were on spot. The welcome fruit basket and daily condo cleanings were great with three kids and a busy dive schedule. It was nice to visit with Diane daily and find out insider tips as well. It was great to not pay of shade or drinks. The ground floor units are great for running in and making a drink, getting a snack and checking out the NCAA scores on the flat screen. The only shocker was the recession along the beach; was much like down the beach in years past. But never fear, there is plenty of sand and great beach space along SMB. All around a great trip and would highly recommend!
reviews.title: Once again, it did not disappoint!

reviews.text: We dove with Off The Wall Divers located in Georgetown below the Lobster Pot and had a great experience with them as well. Ask for Danny!
reviews.title: We return to this place every year.

reviews.text: Discovery Point is far enough away from the cruise ship tourists, but still on the famous Seven Mile Beach, close to restaurants, Stingray City, etc. The snorkeling is fantastic right out in front, and our favorite place, Cemetary Beach is a 5 minute walk. Every condo is ocean front and well laid out, so that the living space faces the ocean. Ollie and Ann Rose couldn't be any nicer or more helpful.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: I stayed at the 3rd floor with my wife and 14 months old son, and everything was great. The staff is very nice and can arrange anything you need. We visited the Dolphing Discovery, Boatswain turtle farm and Stingray city. Amazing experience of a lifetime all of them!!
reviews.title: Nice Choice in Cayman

reviews.text: Based on reviews on trip advisor and the advice of a few friends, we selected Discovery Point for our 5 day pre-xmas vacation. Our goal was to sneak away from the cold, have some family togetherness, snorkel, feed some sting rays and relax in warm weather. Given that we had cloudy overcast weather and rain for the entire stay, we were still able to enjoy ourselves, eat good food, snorkel off the beach (albeit in the rain) and play cards on the porch overlooking palms, sand and water. This location (and frankly any of the 5 or 6 condos surrounding Discovery Point) are in a prime spot for families who want a laid back, safe, water-filled vacation. Some of our friends stay further south on 7 mile so that they can walk to breakfast, book shops and coffee places, but we were thrown off a little by the busy-ness of 7 mile road. I wouldn't want to have to walk along that street or cross that strip several times a day. It's much less busy up by DP, though you do hear traffic breeze by your master suite (parking lot side of the building). But given that we spent most of our time in the LR or screened porch or beach, that wasn't really a problem.
reviews.title: Wonderful trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First trip to grand cayman and decided to stay at DPC and were very impressed with the place. We had a second floor condo #15 with a awesome view of the beach and sunsets. Everything we needed was in the condo and wow I could get use to this kind of life lol. They have a nice pool and hot tub and plenty of sun beds as it was not crowded so no need to get up early. Walks could be taken in either direction to see other resorts and it was nice that they had signs stating the name of the resorts. A little disappointed that on our side of DPC the water entry was rocky but we just moved down two resorts and then entered.. We were more interested in just relaxing and trying to get the dark tan so not that big of a deal. Ollie the manager gave us the keys to a couple of ground floor condos to view so if we ever wanted to return we could get an idea of what they were like and we were not disappointed. Never had any trouble parking as the lot is huge. I would come back again for sure but would like a ground floor unit.
reviews.title: Nice place and beautiful weather and scenery.
Our slice of paradise in Grand Cayman
reviews.text: We just returned from our 3rd visit to Discovery Point Club and our 8th visit to Grand Cayman. Grand Cayman is our favorite destination and Discovery Point Club is the place to stay. The ground-floor, 2-bedroom beachfront unit (#26) was perfect for our 15-night stay. The furniture was very comfortable, the kitchen well equipped and the screened lanai allowed us to eat our meals while enjoying a spectacular view of the beach and outsanding sunsets. Great snorkelling right in front of the condo units. A grocery store within walking distance makes it easy for those of us who like to cook most of our meals. The staff is efficient and friendly and go beyond the call of duty to make your stay comfortable and memorable. The Manager, Ollie, even took my husband and me to the hospital when we suspected my husband had an ear infection. Not only did she drive us both ways, but she stayed with us the whole time at the hospital. Needless to say, we very much appreciated her help and care. We can't wait to return!
Ben and Michele
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect place to stay in Grand Cayman

reviews.text: My family spent 10 days in Grand Cayman, staying at Discovery Point Club the whole time. I have tons of praise and no complaints about this small condo complex. We had a two-bedroom, two-bath condo (#11) on the second floor, which was lovely, clean, quiet and very comfortable. We had a beautiful view of the beach and water. You could eat dinner inside or on the screen porch overlooking the beach (no bugs, though, when we were there in April). We had all amenities -- full kitchen, laundry in the condo, A/C, cable TV, telephone, and internet service. The sandy beach is beautiful, with lots of chairs/umbrellas/cabanas to choose from. The pool was very clean, and the boys (ages 11 and 14) swam there and the ocean, but I much preferred the warm clear Caribbean ocean. We think some of the best snorkeling was right in front of our condo complex -- there are rocks and coral immediately out front full of fish. (On that note, there is no "sandy" swimming right out front, but you can walk a few minutes south or north, and find sandy swimming areas). The water was fantastic -- clear, warm and refreshing. The whole area is extremely safe -- we had no problem sending the boys to swim down the beach or go up to the condo on their own. Fellow travelers were varied -- other families with small children, older couples, middle-aged groups of friends... The front office (AnnRose and Ollie) are quite friendly and knowledgeable, and AnnRose will help you book anything you want to do. The rest of the staff were also extremely friendly and competent. This condo is further down Seven Mile Beach, quite a ways from Georgetown -- no big crowds at all where we were the entire time. Grocery is close, as are several restaurants. Discovery Point Club is just a lovely place to stay, and we would absolutely stay there again.
reviews.title: The Perfect Vacation

reviews.text: My husband and 2 children (ages 10 and 7) had a wonderful vacation here. This was our third trip to Cayman and so far, the best place we've stayed yet. (The other two were the Westin and Treasure Island). Ollie and AnnRose (as well as any other staff you may meet) are so very helpful and friendly. We stayed in Unit #16 and it was beautifully decorated, spacious and spotless as well. I was really impressed with how clean the resort is overall. We had a washer and dryer in the unit, and it came in handy for drying wet beach towels. There are beach towels provided for every unit. My children especially liked the balcony overlooking the most gorgeous view of the pool/beach/water. Most places don't have such large, completely screened in balconies. The pool is also very clean and right next to the beach, so it's possible to see your children in the pool while sitting on the beach. There are even umbrellas and chairs, all included in your rental, and we never had any problem getting one. Being so close to the Turtle Farm and Cemetary Beach is a nice plus also. There is great snorkeling right outside the units - but beware of the rocks - they are VERY SLIPPERY when wet! We can't wait to come back!
reviews.title: No better place to stay on Grand Cayman
FABULOUS family getaway at DPC - am already dreaming about returning!
reviews.text: I cannot say enough how amazing our trip was!! We were traveling with our two young boys who absolutely loved the beach and the pool. They learned to snorkel on the beach outside the condo. We loved the convenience of the first floor condo so we could run in for snacks or bathroom breaks. We had great dinners at Calypso Grill, Eats Cafe and Luca. We enjoyed a morning spent on the beach at Rum Point as well. The condo was beautiful and clean. AnnRose was so very helpful and sweet to the boys. We are going to start saving again so we can return sometime soon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Discovery Point Club for 5 nights (stay for 4, get the 5th free!) for a friend's wedding and thoroughly enjoyed our experience. The property and condo were both very clean and well maintained. The staff was more than friendly and helpful anytime we had a question even offering us a ride to where we were meeting the rest of the wedding group to breakfast one morning!
reviews.title: Great experience at Discovery Point Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: DPC is on the north end of Seven Mile Beach but it is within walking distance to a grocery store and a few bars and restaurants giving you a nice balance of a quiet location and accessibility to stores.
reviews.title: Well Maintained, Excellent Staff, Beautiful Location

reviews.text: The accommodations are very nice and the entire facility is well maintained. Probably can find other accommodations just as nice but the icing on the cake is AnnRose and Ollie. They go out of their way to ensure all your needs are met. Need a reservation, they will take care of it and because of their knowledge of island activities, they will recommend the best choices for your interests. All the staff was very friendly and enjoyed sharing their experiences and cultural knowledge of the island.
reviews.title: Excellent Location; Fantastic Unit

reviews.text: Our family of four stayed at Discovery Point for four nights in April 2010 (our first time). The condos are located on Seven Mile Beach, slightly north of the "main" beach area (Ritz Carlton, Westin, Marriott, etc.), which is actually quite nice and relaxing. The beach (including the hotel's chairs, umbrellas, etc.) was never too crowded and there are fantastic snorkeling areas immediately in front of the property (go out about 100-150 yards for the best marine life). The condo itself (2-bedroom) was very comfortable and was furnished nicely (and the in-unit washer/dryer was a great convenience). The view from the third-floor unit was absolutely fantastic! We tried to get a ground-floor unit, but ended up being very happy on the third floor (beware--no elevator). All of the units are furnished by the individual owners, so these comments do not necessarily apply to the entire property.
reviews.title: Relaxing Family Reunion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I visited Grand Cayman (again) to dive and relax. We chose the Discovery Point Club condominiums this time. It is located on the upper part of 7 Mile Beach near West Bay. We think it is the quiter and prettier part of the beach. The property is excellently maintained and is a pleasure to visit. Ourt condo (unit #12) was very pretty with an excellent kitchen (we heard the unit belonged to a gourmet chef). It has the usual oven, microwave, and an espresso machine, and another appliance which we couldn't identify (steamer?). Nice unit as the furniture was in great shape, and the bed was confortable. The AC worked good as we needed it, it was hot-hot-hot even for August in Grand Cayman.
reviews.title: Great vacation, Great Condo

reviews.text: The beach area was superbly maintained and we super to sit and read or check out the beautiful beach and ocean. Great pool as well. Snorkeling off the beach was good (we dive so we expect a lot!), but the local diving is great. Contact SeaSports for a good diver operation.
reviews.title: We'll be back!

reviews.text: Renting a condo is not cheap, but it is a great value for the money. We stocked our fridge and ate breakfast in the room daily. Likewise, lunch was in the cool condo, or down on the beach. Dinner out.
reviews.title: Phenomenal!

reviews.text: perfect location right on the beach, with plenty of shade allows the enitre family to relax together. And if you go in the warmer months, having the AC in the condo is good for a midday break from the sun!
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: good snorkeling esp. to the right in front of the mansion next door -- very simple and easy for beginners and like an aquarium -- not much coral but plenty of fish.
reviews.title: Fantastic place

aka: Discovery Point Club Hotel Seven Mile Beach
